title: Is it always right to be right?
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Academy awards (Motion pictures)
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - Awards
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Conflict of generations
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Race discrimination
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Conflict of generations
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Conflict of generations
description: This fast moving parable, designed to provoke discussion without alienating any group, highlights the centres of divisiveness in our society, the generation gap, poverty, war and race. It tells of a land "where men were always right". This animated film is a winner of many awards including an Academy Award. Narrated by Orson Welles.
